Dem Moda

A 3D model of the cafe called Dem Moda, where I work as a waiter.

I worked on the project for about 3 months, and it took over 100 hours to complete. The only software I used was Blender.

Initially, I envisioned this project as a continuation of a series of portraits I started some time ago, but as I progressed and added more details, I wanted it to become a detailed isometric illustration. It turned out to be a work in the style of the European Side Magazine Office, and I am quite satisfied with the final result.

As I progressed with the project, maintaining motivation was challenging due to the high level of detail. This was one of the biggest difficulties I faced. From this project, I learned that having a clear plan and determining the level of detail beforehand can be very beneficial when starting a project. This way, I would enter a process where I can foresee the steps ahead. In this project, I kept adding details continuously, not knowing exactly where to stop.
